html: More than 50 years after the passage of the Voting Rights Act, democratic rights are still under threat. I am a proud cosponsor of #HR4, the Voting Rights Advancement Act, to #RestoreTheVote and make it easier, not harder, to cast your ballot.
text:
More than 50 years after the passage of the Voting Rights Act, democratic rights are still under threat. 

I am a proud cosponsor of #HR4, the Voting Rights Advancement Act, to #RestoreTheVote and make it easier, not harder, to cast your ballot.

html: Be ready for a power outage: Turn your fridge to the coldest setting. Charge mobile phones and other electric equipment now. Put a thermometer in the fridge. If the temp is 40 degrees or higher when power's restored, throw food out. #Florencepic.twitter.com/zZ78sSFiF5
text:
Be ready for a power outage:

Turn your fridge to the coldest setting.
Charge mobile phones and other electric equipment now.
Put a thermometer in the fridge. If the temp is 40 degrees or higher when power's restored, throw food out. 

#Florencepic.twitter.com/zZ78sSFiF5

html: #FlorenceNC safety tips: - STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm. - Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. - If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home. - Have your emergency kit ready!
text:
#FlorenceNC safety tips:
- STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm.
- Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. 
- If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home.
- Have your emergency kit ready!

text:
PARKING DECKS OPEN DURING STORM

We're opening 4 parking decks for free parking during #HurricaneFlorence for those nervous about cars flooding. These will open Thursday at 12pm until Monday at 7am.

-City Center/RedHat
-Moore Square
-Wilmington Street Station
-Municipal Building
